content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────────────
● Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network
  Consists of:
  – Stone Furnace at Position(x=0.0, y=0.0) equipped with adjacent burner‑inserters and connected to input/output wooden chests.
  – Stone Furnace at Position(x=5.0, y=0.0) similarly configured.
  (This structure remains unchanged.)

● Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup
  Consists of:
  – Burner‑Mining Drill at Position(x=-15.0, y=-50.0) feeding into a Wooden Chest at Position(x=-13.5, y=-51.5) via transport belts.
  (No updates from the previous report.)

● Steam Power Generation System
  Consists of:
  – Boiler at Position(x=8.0, y=20.5) supplying steam; its area is populated with multiple connection elements.
  – Steam Engines (Generators) deployed at various positions:
  • Generator at Position(x=0.5, y=9.5)
  • Generator at Position(x=18.5, y=11.5)
  • Generator at Position(x=1.5, y=13.5)
  • Generator at Position(x=13.5, y=14.5)
  • Generator at Position(x=19.5, y=14.5)
  • Generator at Position(x=22.5, y=18.5)
  • Generator at Position(x=17.5, y=20.5)
  • Generator at Position(x=12.5, y=21.5)
  • Generator at Position(x=4.5, y=23.5)
  – An extra steam engine was intended to expand the system; however, its placement near the buildable area (approximately Position(x=8.5, y=22.5)) remains unachieved due to severe congestion.
  (The system is otherwise intact but continues to exhibit the unresolved extra engine placement.)

● Automation Research Lab
  Consists of:
  – A Lab unit configured to accept automation‑science‑pack inputs.
  (It is still not powered, with no modifications noted.)

● Electrical and Transport Infrastructure
  Consists of interconnected groups:
  – Electricity Groups linking poles across the network.
  – Belt Groups and Pipe Groups that form the backbone of material and fluid conveyance.
  (These networks persist unchanged.)

ERROR TIPS
─────────────────────────────
• Extra Steam Engine Placement Failures
  – Congestion around the boiler at Position(8.0, 20.5) has led to overlapping and misaligned burner‑inserters and transport belts.
  – The designated buildable region (approx. Position(8.5, 22.5)) remains entirely obstructed.
  – Mitigation strategies include a thorough manual inspection of the boiler area, removal or repositioning of conflicting entities, and/or relocating the extra steam engine to a less congested zone. Alternatively, modifying the boiler layout to improve clearance for connections is advisable.

• Persistent “Out of Fuel” Warnings
  – Multiple burner‑inserters and mining drills are consistently signaling an “out of fuel” status.
  – Regular refueling routines should be instituted to maintain uninterrupted operation.

• Generator Connection and Fluid Input Issues
  – Numerous steam engines raise warnings such as “not connected to power network” and “no input liquid.”
  – Verification of proper power, fluid, and connection point alignments is essential to achieve full operational status.

• Lab Power Deficiency
  – The Automation Research Lab remains without power.
  – Ensure that the lab’s electrical links are rechecked and integrated into the network to deliver the necessary energy.

(All reported errors reflect recurring issues observed in the latest diagnostic steps.)
